subject: Sales
title: Repositioning: When Brands Reinvent
description: A micro-lesson that makes Repositioning: When Brands Reinvent usable.

hook.text: Old Spice was your grandfather's aftershave until one campaign made it the top men's body wash brand.

buildup.text: Repositioning changes how the market perceives an existing brand. It's a rebirth, not a new launch.

discovery.text: Successful repositioning keeps core strengths while dramatically shifting the audience or the image.

twist.text: Most repositioning fails because existing perceptions are stubborn. Only bold, sustained moves break through.

climax.text: If your brand feels stale, find what still resonates and reframe it boldly for a new audience.

punchline.text: Old brands don't die. They reinvent for new audiences.

quiz.question: What does successful repositioning require?
options: Keeping core strengths while shifting perception boldly
